CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 9, 1957, pg. B4 reads: "Student Voters - Throughout the Pittsburgh public school system the junior and senior high school participated in a mock election on Nov. 5. The purpose of giving the students a chance to vote was to familiarize students with voting procedures and better prepare them for the responsibility of voting, when they reach the correct age.  Shown in the photo are Westinghouse High School students, who are in the midst of the Tuesday school election.  They are, left to right: Handson Thomas, Leona Brown, Frances Gesuall, Francine Borland, back to camera Sandra Bell, Ernestine Favor and Carolyn Stoner. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Students, from left: Handson Thomas, Leona Brown, Frances Gesuall, Francine Borland facing away, Sandra Bell, Ernestine Favor, and Carolyn Stoner, participating in mock election in Westinghouse High School classroom
